div1.p: President, Charles C. Bonnet. Vice-President THOS. B. Bryan.
Treasurer, Lyman J. Gage. Secretary, Benjamin Butterworth.
The World's Congress Auxiliary Of The World's Columbian Exposition.
Joseph H. Roy, D.D> Chairman. George W. Gray, D.D. Vice-Chairman Frederic P Noble, Secretary (New- berry Library). Arthur Howards, D.D. Northwestern Christian Advocate E. Burritt Smith, Esq.
Isaac Chaplin, Esq. John J. Jenifer, D.D. Mr. J. W. Busbey, Chicago Inter Occan. J.L. Withrow, D.D. Hon. B.C. Cook Rev. L.P. Mercer C.C. Adams, New York Sen
Hon. Alfred Le Ghait, E.E.&M.P. Washington, D.C. Dear Sir:-

In our daily program, which we will soon send you, we plan to give the forenoon of the first day, Monday August 14th, to the reception of the members of the Congress on Africa and to addresses of response. In behalf of the Committee I write to invite yourself to respond on the part of that distinguised land which you represent so honorably to the governmentof the United States. We think that it would be the fitting and gracious thing for one in your position to speak the opening word for those of your country, who are to bring to this Congress their contributions of wisdom in support of the example of their illustrious King, who still keeps himself on the lead in this process of re-discovering Africa. We hope that you will give our earnest request an affirmtive reply. May we not hear from you without delay?
Respectfully yours, Jos B. Roy Chairman
